Introduction to the BCDR Plan and its primary objectives

chunks.text: The primary objective of this BCDR Plan is to minimize the impact of unforeseen events (natural disasters, system failures, power outages, etc.) on our core logistics services (Safety, Quality, Delivery). We commit to the protection of personnel, client cargo, and vital business data, ensuring an acceptable level of service continuity.

chunks.text: 4.0 Disaster Scenario: Major Power and Network Outage

metadata.section_title: Disaster Scenario: Major Power and Network Outage
metadata.context: Scenario description for major power and network outage
Steps for response and activation during a major disruption

chunks.text:
1. Immediate Action: IC to declare Level 2 (Major Disruption).
2. Communication: Activate satellite/backup communication devices. Notify all critical personnel via SMS/alternative channel.
3. WMS/IT: IT Lead immediately switches to off-site cloud servers (if applicable) or initiates Backup & Recovery Procedure (Refer to IT Manual).

metadata.context: Immediate actions for response and activation
Protocol for maintaining logistics continuity during disruptions

chunks.text:
● Dispatch: Switch to manual dispatch procedures using pre-printed Delivery Order (DO) and Bill of Lading (BOL) forms. Log all movements via secure chat groups.
● Warehouse: Halt all non-critical picking/packing. Receiving must be done manually, creating handwritten Receiving Reports. No movement of High-Value Cargo without dual sign-off.
● Data: Once systems are restored, all manual records must be prioritized for data entry to meet RPO of 12 hours for WMS data.

metadata.context: Steps for logistics continuity during a major disruption
